alert.note: Alert for Clark; Jackson; Monroe (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 8:04PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clark, Jackson, northwestern Monroe and Trempealeau Counties through 845 PM CST... At 804 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Humbird to near Galesville. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Humbird around 810 PM CST. Neillsville around 820 PM CST. Blair around 830 PM CST. Loyal and Greenwood around 835 PM CST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Franklin, Highway 73 And 98, Shamrock, The Black River Correctional Center, Atwood, Tioga, Potters Flowage, Chimney Rock, Perry Creek Recreation Area and Lynn. This includes Interstate 94 between mile markers 88 and 129. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
